body_content.explanation: a circular object like a wheel with which a trailer (= a vehicle that is pulled) can be connected to the vehicle that is pulling it:
examples: If you only tow occasionally, you can remove and install the fifth wheel as needed.
A large pin underneath the front of the trailer interlocks with the fifth wheel.

body_content.explanation: a caravan that has a front part that covers the flat back part of the vehicle that is pulling it :
examples: My mom and dad would like to get a fifth wheel and travel across the country spending a month here or a couple of weeks there.
They sold their home and now live in a fifth-wheel.
He lives in a fifth-wheel trailer on property his family owns.
He and his wife crisscross the country in a pickup, towing their one-bedroom, fifth-wheel camper.

body_content.explanation: someone or something that is not needed or wanted in a particular situation:
examples: Sometimes I look down the line of guitar players and think that I am just the fifth wheel here, that these guys don't need me in this band.
They asked me to join them but I replied that I would only be a fifth wheel.
The report called the coordinating agency for the state's two higher education systems, an "unnecessary fifth wheel".
